CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 27, 1952, pg. 28 reads: AMVETS Hold Christmas Party At Termon Home - Pennsylvania Amvets held a Christmas party for the children at the Termon Avenue Home for Children, North Side, on Monday. Each year, the organization of ex-servicemen, picks an orphanage to shower with gifts.  In addition to a television set, the youngsters received many other presents.  Edward F. Tuchsherder is chairman of the Santa Claus committee.  Also taking part this year were members of the new Amvets post in Hill District, of which Sterling Gilliam was recently elected commander.  In the picture are Robert Collinger of Amvets Post 28, Wyatt Williams of Amvets Post 164, Charles Grigsby of Amvets Post 96, and Frank Kokal of Amvets Post 73.  Ed Mushinski played the part of Santa Claus. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of five Amvets members, standing, left to right: Robert Collinger, Wyatt Williams, Charles Grigsby, and Frank Kokal; seated: Ed Mushinski, wearing Santa Claus costume, and children, including two boys wearing plaid shirts, in Termon Avenue Home for Children, North Side, another version
